intro: Astrotricha glabra, commonly known as the smooth astertricha, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Astrotricha glabra is often found in moist soils and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
